data.title: University of Manchester Young Fabians (2024)
data.text:
09/06/2022

📢 The Manchester Jean Monnet Centre of Excellence is thrilled to be moderating and co-hosting with the University of Manchester Students' Uniona live event with the President of Ukraine 🇺🇦, His Excellency, Mr. Volodymyr Zelenskyy

📅 Friday, 10th of June 2022*

🕟 4.30 pm (BST/ London, UK Time)

📍 Manchester Museum, 3rd Floor (entrance from Bridgeford Street)

ATTENDANCE OF THE EVENT IS ONLY GOING TO BE POSSIBLE IN PERSON

*The event is FREE & OPEN to all but admission will be offered on a strictly first-come-first-served basis

Live Discussion with the President of Ukraine, His Excellency Mr. Volodymyr Zelensky

28/04/2022

📢 Join us in less than a week for the Manchester Jean Monnet Centre of Excellence ➋⓪➋➋ Annual Lecture!

📅 Wednesday, May 4, 2022

🕑 16.00 – 17.30 (UK Time)

🔴 Prof. Nathalie Tocci Harvard Kennedy School Istituto Affari Internazionali - IAI

🔴 Discussant: Dimitris Kourkoulas (Hellenic Foundation for European & Foreign Policy (ELIAMEP) (ELIAMEP)

📌 From the age of idealism to the age of war on the European continent

🎫 RSVP & Registration

https://bit.ly/JMCE_Tocci_2022

or via Eventbrite 👇

https://jmce_tocci_2022.eventbrite.co.uk

*ALL WELCOME but registration is essential

JMCE Annual Lecture 2022 - From the age of idealism to the age of war on the European continent

14/04/2021

Join the University of Manchester Young Fabians for our Brexit and International Students event!

08/04/2021

📢 EVENT ALERT 📢

👉 WHAT: Brexit and International Students

👉 WHEN: Wednesday 14th April from 6-7pm

👉 WHERE: Online! Sign up below!

⬇️ More Info Below ⬇️

The University of Manchester Young Fabians welcomes you all to attend our event on the Impact of Brexit on International Students!

The United Kingdom's departure from the European Union has had a substantial impact on the thousands of international students who live and study in this country, and it is an issue that has not been given the attention it deserves. We will be joined by Catherine West MP, Dimitris Papadimitriou, Lara Pizotto, and Martin Penov.

Sound like your sort of thing? Sign up here: https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/impact_of_brexit_on_international_students?utm_campaign=website&utm_source=uc&utm_medium=email

Impact of Brexit on International Students Join the University of Manchester Young Fabians the Young Fabians International Network for a discussion of the impact of Brexit on international students.

11/03/2021

We would like to introduce our new Woman’s Officer Beth Walker!! Please help us give her a warm welcome 🙏

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the tenth and final post of our blog takeover, Amy Dwyer writes about academic expectations and the inadequate support offered to students by many Universities.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/we_need_a_safety_net

We Need a Safety Net During the last academic year, university students saw a safety net policy, introduced to mitigate against the highly disruptive impact of the coronavirus pandemic. This policy was welcomed by students and lecturers alike and seen as a way to guarantee that students would still be receiving the grad...

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In our ninth article for our blog takeover, Ben Murphy writes about student experiences with housing during the pandemic, and how this has impacted their performance and mental health.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/coming_or_going_students_and_housing_during_the_pandemic

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the EIGHTH (!) article of our Blog Takeover, Conrad Fallon discusses how the marketisation of education & precarious employment practices have impacted the teaching staff & students in universities during the pandemic.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/covid_19_and_the_marketisation_of_education

Covid-19 and the Marketisation of education Conrad Fallon discusses how the marketisation of education and precarious employment practices have impacted the teaching staff and students in universities during the pandemic.

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the seventh article of our Blog Takeover, Dan Wood reflects upon moving to Manchester to study during the pandemic.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/coming_to_manchester

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the sixth article of our Blog Takeover, Beth Walker discusses the controversial post by the University of Manchester telling students "Don't see this as a lockdown, but as a retreat".

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/retreat

Retreat Beth Walker discusses the controversial post by the University of Manchester: "Don't see this as a lockdown, but as a retreat".

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the fifth article of our Blog Takeover, Jonny Winbow reflects on the impact of Covid-19 on the LGBTQIA+ community and what more needs to be done to support LGBTQIA+ young people at university.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/lgbtqia_student_loneliness

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the fourth article of our Blog Takeover, Martin Penov discusses the unique challenges faced by international students during the pandemic with a particular focus upon those at the University of Manchester.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/the_other_side_manchester_s_international_students_at_a_time_of_crisis

The Other Side: Manchester’s International Students at a Time of Crisis Martin Penov discusses the unique challenges faced by international students during the pandemic with a particular focus upon those at the University of Manchester.

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the third article of our Blog Takeover, Amy Brennan discusses how the pandemic has impacted students, the response of universities, and reflects upon the protests.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/students_the_afterthought_of_the_covid_19_pandemic

Students: The Afterthought of the Covid-19 Pandemic Amy Brennan discusses how the pandemic has impacted students, the response of universities, and reflects upon the protests.

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the second article for our Blog Takeover, Luke MacGregor discusses the detrimental impact of our postgraduate loan system and COVID-19 on working class students.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/priced_out_how_the_postgraduate_funding_system_and_covid_19_is_the_perfect_storm_for_postgrad_working_class_students

Priced Out: How the Postgraduate Funding System and Covid-19 Is the “Perfect” Storm for Postgrad Working Class Students The many failures and shortcomings of the Government's response to the coronavirus pandemic are well documented and well known to anyone likely to read this article. However, these failings, when coupled with an already unfair and regressive system of funding for potential masters students, leave a....

05/03/2021

📰 BLOG TAKEOVER 📰

In the first article for our Blog Takeover, Katherine Thirkettle discusses the impact of the pandemic on young people's mental health and what more needs to be done to address this crisis.

https://www.youngfabians.org.uk/the_student_mental_health_crisis_we_need_to_further_the_discussion

The Student Mental Health Crisis: We Need to Further the Discussion Katherine Thirkettle discusses the impact of the pandemic on young people's mental health and what more needs to be done to address this crisis.

05/03/2021

Yesterday was University Mental Health Day. To mark the occasion, our society is taking over the Young Fabians Blog with a series of thoughtful articles that aim to discuss the impact of the pandemic on students and its implications for mental health.

Keep an eye on this page for updates on these articles by our talented members! 👏

20/02/2021

📢 MONTHLY MEETING 📢

It's that time of the month again! We're having our monthly meeting on Monday 22nd February at 7pm. Our monthly meetings are a great chance to get to know the rest of the society and help decide what we should do in the future.

We have some interesting events and writing opportunities for our members this month!

There will also be an opportunity for members to join an expanded executive committee.

13/01/2021

University of Manchester Young Fabian's first event

12/01/2021

Don't forget our first event Student Mental Health and Coronavirus is tomorrow at 7pm!

We'll be joined by Kate Green MP, Emma Hardy MP, Dr Rosena Allin-Khan MP and Kira Lewis.

I'll try my best to get the event up on Facebook Live, so feel free to watch it either on there or on zoom. But if I'm not able to sort out the FB Live here is the link to register for the zoom, you can do so at any time including after the event has started so even if you miss the start you can join for the rest :)

https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJEtdO6hqDsiEtOMST8oJYihZWATt8Gmik4l

09/01/2021

Join us on Wednesday, for our premiere event on how the Coronavirus has affected student Mental Health

We’re very excited to announce THREE Shadow Ministers: Education, Mental Health and Universities, and Kira Lewis, Student Activist and Disability Officer at KCL, all lead by our fabulous Chair and Secretary

Zoom Link: https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJEtdO6hqDsiEtOMST8oJYihZWATt8Gmik4l

Facebook Link: https://fb.me/e/3EIvAXfxc

05/01/2021

📢 POLICY EVENT ALERT 📢

WHAT: Student Mental Health and Coronavirus

WHEN: Wednesday 13th January, 7-8pm

WHERE: It's on Zoom, so wherever you want it to be!

===

The University of Manchester Young Fabians is pleased to announce our first policy event, focusing on how the coronavirus pandemic has affected the mental wellbeing of students and young people across the UK.

We are set to be joined by Kate Green MP, Emma Hardy MP, and Kira Lewis, who will be offering their perspectives on this emerging crisis.

All of you are - of course - welcome to attend, and contribute your ideas and perspectives. As England heads into its third lockdown, and with university students again largely forgotten by the government, this conversation could not be more important.

If this sounds like your kind of thing, make sure to register here:

https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJEtdO6hqDsiEtOMST8oJYihZWATt8Gmik4l

Welcome! You are invited to join a meeting: Student Mental Health and Coronavirus. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the meeting. Join the University of Manchester Young Fabians for their first event: Student Mental Health and Coronavirus

15/12/2020

❄️⛄️ ❄️⛄️❄️⛄️

🎅🏻 CHRISTMAS SOCIAL 🤶🏻

WHAT: UoMs Young Fabians 1st Social

WHEN: Wednesday 16th, 6:30-9pm

WHERE: it’s on Zoom, so your bedroom, your sitting room, wherever you like (just please no bathrooms!)

Does a fun night of Frosty Festivities and progressive politics sound fun to you? Then join us for our first ever christmas social, Christmas Jumpers encouraged

We’ll be planning our first event on the Coronavirus and Student Mental Health, with a shadow minister already lined up to speak, got any ideas for speakers or blog posts you’d like to write? Then tomorrow is your time to shine

Newcomers will be warmly welcomed

From 7: there’ll be actual fun* Christmas Quizzes, drinking games, socialising as a group, chatting about politics and if you’re lucky some Christmas Keir

It’s not like you’ve got anywhere better to be?

Zoom Registration: https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJMrc-yqpjsvG9UPo_lUUSvOtVP8f25Gcyth

*if you have a certain way of thinking, tickets are non-refundable based on your definition of fun

❄️⛄️❄️⛄️❄️⛄️

Welcome! You are invited to join a meeting: UoM and North West Young Fabian Xmas Social. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the meeting. Welcome! You are invited to join a meeting: UoM and North West Young Fabian Xmas Social. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the meeting.

05/12/2020

Hey Everyone!

We are aware that several of you have had trouble singing up through the Students' Union website, and we're working to fix this as soon as we can!

Until then - the best way to keep in touch with the University of Manchester Young Fabians is to join our WhatsApp chat. In this chat, we plan our upcoming events and just generally get to know eachother. If you are unable to join, don't worry - we will make sure to keep you up to date with key information on this page.

Here is the link to join the chat:

https://chat.whatsapp.com/ClugWX0L704BPjkbchgjkY

WhatsApp Group Invite WhatsApp Group Invite

05/12/2020

Have a listen to the new North West Young Fabians podcast episode

New Wave: Devolution is it working? by The New Wave: North West Young Fabian Podcast • A podcast on Anchor This Episode we are joined by the North West Young Fabian Vice-Chair Helen Clarke to discuss Devolution and its future in the United Kingdom. We explore how devolution is working, how it can improve, to what extent Britain supports Devolution and if Manchester supports Andy Burnham as 'King of the N...

28/11/2020

Not long now till our christmas social and next meeting, where we'll be planning our first event: Student Mental Health and Coronavirus. If you haven't already registered, you can by following the link below, but make sure to save the date: Wednesday 16th December at 6:30pm

The first half hour will be planning the event (we already have a shadow minister confirmed!) and sorting out speakers

Then from 7pm we'll be joined by the North West Young Fabians for a quiz, drinking games etc.

https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJMrc-yqpjsvG9UPo_lUUSvOtVP8f25Gcyth

https://www.facebook.com/events/3535896439825416/

Welcome! You are invited to join a meeting: UoM and North West Young Fabian Xmas Social. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the meeting. Welcome! You are invited to join a meeting: UoM and North West Young Fabian Xmas Social. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the meeting.

26/11/2020

Call for writers: we want to hear your experience of universities and coronavirus for a UoM Young Fabian blog takeover. We're looking for pieces on the neglect of mental health, protests in Fallowfield, zoom university, general handling of the pandemic by the university, tuition fees etc.

Send us a message or email us at [email protected] with your pitch :)

We're also putting together our first event: Student Mental Health and Coronavirus

If you want to be involved, come along to our next meeting on 16th December at 7pm where we will be discussing the event, potential speakers and dates. Here is the link to sign up:

https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJMrc-yqpjsvG9UPo_lUUSvOtVP8f25Gcyth

Welcome! You are invited to join a meeting: UoM and North West Young Fabian Xmas Social. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the meeting. Welcome! You are invited to join a meeting: UoM and North West Young Fabian Xmas Social. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the meeting.

25/11/2020

Come and join our event chaired by our inclusion officer, Jonny Winbow. Here is the FB live:

https://www.facebook.com/youngfabians/videos/691912541712108

23/11/2020

Great event tonight from the Young Fabians Economy & Finance Network and Young Fabians Arts + Culture Network

EVENT TONIGHT 7pm 📢

Join the Young Fabians Economy & Finance Network and Arts & Culture Network to hear guests including Jo Stevens MP, Labour's Shadow Culture Minister, discuss the economic crisis facing the and sectors 🎭 🎭 🎭

The discussion will be chaired by Victoria Parrett, Chair of the YF Arts and Culture Network. It's one not to be missed!!

There's still time to sign up on Zoom 👉 https://t.co/iHAbfjJKI1?amp=1

20/11/2020

We've heard that some people are struggling to sign up to our society on the SU website.

If you've had issues with this, comment below or send us a message and we'll sort it out :)

In the meantime, we'll make sure everything our members need to know is posted on here

10/11/2020

After a great second meeting, we're please to announce our extended committee as follows:

Chair: Amy Dwyer

Secretary/Inclusions Officer: Jonny Winbow

Vice-Chair: Daniel Wood

Outreach/Events Officer: Ben Murphy

If anyone wants to get involved, sign up via the SU website or send us an email at [email protected] :)
